Ok, I am working on an update that completely changes how the Clouds are rendered (PQS instead of multiple cameras) that should help for volumetric clouds and framerate, and I need some feedback for what people want next.

Here's my personal order, with an addition because I'm never happy with anything given to me:

Daytime Cities (grey patches on the day side where there are bright spots on the night side)

Procedural Cloud Cover

Volumetric Clouds (to fly through)

Planetary Rings/Asteroid belts (collidable)

Planetary Aurora or Other Meteorological effects (lightning, rain, meteor streaks [visual effect only])

Misc Particle effects (collision dust, landing tire smoke, etc)

Though really the last 3 are any order. All are desirable but not as much as the first 3.

I think the two requests that you probably already know but have been kind of buried are having the clouds blot out city lights, and mine which is find a way to stop the cities from floating? They still float on my game, about five kilometers up. But the thing is, I don't know if this is intended behavior. I've tried reinstalling the mod to no avail and I'm almost positive this wasn't the case in 5.3 (though I haven't gone back to check). So, if nothing else, can I get a definitive answer on that? They're not quite so bad for me (at least I don't think so) but they are off the ground. I believe it's a problem that he can't map them to the terrain and can instead just map them to a sphere. So if they're too low, the terrain will actually clip into them and cause them to vanish in highlands.

Though I may be wrong about that. I remember an early picture in the beta thread that showed a city "underwater" which implies there's some conforming to the terrain.
